snippet: The country’s largest Internet merchants are working to improve logistics in China, a country plagued by delivery inefficiency.
abstract: Chinese e-commerce market is burgeoning, and is already bigger than that of United States; decades of underinvestment in inland infrastructure, however, has caused slow deliveries to interior of country, and damage of delivered goods is a persistent and costly problem; online merchants like Alibaba and JD.com are working together to improve distribution by building more warehouses at critical locations and streamlining delivery.

byline.original: By SHANSHAN WANG and PAUL MOZUR

lead_paragraph: The country’s largest Internet merchants are working to improve logistics in China, a country plagued by delivery inefficiency.

headline.main: Alibaba and Others Push to Improve Delivery, on Singles’ Day in China
headline.print_headline: Buying Is Easy. Delivery Is Hard.
